definition: person representing the dead (during burial ceremonies)/to put a corpse on display (after execution)/variant of 屍|尸[shi1]/corpse
person representing the dead (during burial ceremonies)/to put a corpse on display (after execution)/variant of 屍|尸[shi1]/corpse
walking corpse (idiom)/zombie/person who lives only on the material level
lit. reincarnated in sb else's body (idiom); fig. a discarded or discredited idea returns in another guise

sentences.english: He mutilated the nun and stuffed into a closet.
sentences.chinese: 他杀了一名修女，他碎尸然后把尸体赛进柜子。

sentences.english: Ashes of the corpse that stands, an unburied death.

sentences.english: John's disciples came and took his body and buried it.

sentences.english: The corpse was named "Corpse of Mawangdui" and this name has been accepted internationally.
sentences.chinese: 国际上已认同，将这种尸体命名为“马王堆尸”。

sentences.english: Seventeen days later, Jiang vote in May 5th, five days after carrying out the dead father.

sentences.english: While the Decaying Ghoul remains alive, nearby enemies continue to be slowed.
sentences.chinese: 当食尸鬼存在时，附近的敌军被持续减速。

sentences.english: Crows and dogs fight each other for the right to gnaw on a putrid human corpse.

sentences.english: There was no need to tell him to make haste: he also had been thinking a good deal about ghouls.
sentences.chinese: 无需告诉他赶紧回去，他也已经对食尸鬼想得很多了。

sentences.english: What about the Chinese person who was dismembered in Canada?

sentences.english: The thickness of soft tissues of sole was observed and measured on 64 sides of feet of adult cadavers.
sentences.chinese: 在64侧成尸下肢标本上对足底软组织进行了观测。

sentences.english: Poison was detected in the dead man's stomach.
